protocol_name: Blue-fronted Amazon roosts in five roosts in Brazil Seixas and Mourao 2018
protocol_name_html: Blue-fronted Amazon roosts in five roosts in Brazil Seixas and Mourao 2018
documents: [{"url":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/pr-journal/5t5jwme.xlsx","file_id":"28219","thumb_url":"/img/extensions/xlsx.png","ofn":"Blue-fronted Amazon roosts in five roosts in Brazil Seixas and Mourao 2018.xlsx"}]
description: S1 Table. Pooled counts of Blue-fronted Amazons. Counts were performed in five roosts by month in the southern Pantanal of Brazil from July 2004 to July 2009. “Roost” is the roost id (1-5), “all.parrots” refers to the number of parrots arriving at roosts irrespective of the group size, “singles” refer to the numbers of singletons, “pairs” refer to numbers of dyads arriving the roosts. “Fledglings” are the number of young fledged in family flocks, “family.flocks” refers to the number of parrots arriving the roosts in small flocks of three to six birds, and “large.flocks” refer to number of the number of parrots arriving the roosts in large flocks (i.e. > 7 parrots). (XLSX)
manuscript_citation: Seixas, G. H. F. & Mourão, G. 2018. Communal roosts of the Blue-fronted Amazons (Amazona aestiva) in a large tropical wetland: are they of different types? Submitted to Plos One.
keywords: Communal roosts, Psittacidae, parrots, conservation, Pantanal
status_info: We use this document in our group and it is working
